item.title: Exploited Zero-Day Flaw in Cisco UC Could Affect Millions
item.description:
Mass scanning is underway for CVE-2026-20045, which Cisco tagged as critical because successful exploitation could lead to a complete system takeover.
ğŸ“° Source: Dark Reading | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Swipe, Plug-in, Pwned: Researchers Find New Ways to Hack Vehicles
item.description:
Security researchers exploited dozens of vulnerabilities in vehicle infotainment systems and EV chargers during the latest Pwn2Own contest at Automotive World 2026.
ğŸ“° Source: Dark Reading | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Sandworm Blamed for Wiper Attack on Poland Power Grid
item.description:
Researchers attributed the failed attempt to the infamous Russian APT Sandworm, which is notorious for wiper attacks on critical infrastructure organizations.
ğŸ“° Source: Dark Reading | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Beauty in Destruction: Exploring Malware's Impact Through Art
item.description:
Artistic initiatives turn cybersecurity into immersive exhibits at the Museum of Malware Art, transforming digital threats into thought-provoking experiences.
ğŸ“° Source: Dark Reading | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: WorldLeaks Extortion Group Claims It Stole 1.4TB of Nike Data
item.description:
The sportswear brand is investigating an alleged breach of its network that exposed some 188,347 files of highly sensitive corporate data.
ğŸ“° Source: Dark Reading | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: 'Stanley' Toolkit Turns Chrome Into Undetectable Phishing Vector
item.description:
The malware-as-a-service kit enables malicious extensions to overlay pages on real websites without changing the visible URL, signaling a fresh challenge for enterprise security.
ğŸ“° Source: Dark Reading | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Critical Telnet Server Flaw Exposes Forgotten Attack Surface
item.description:
While telnet is considered obsolete, the network protocol is still used by hundreds of thousands of legacy systems and IoT devices for remote access.
ğŸ“° Source: Dark Reading | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Vibe-Coded 'Sicarii' Ransomware Can't Be Decrypted
item.description:
A new ransomware strain that entered the scene last year has poorly designed code and uses Hebrew language that might be a false flag.
ğŸ“° Source: Dark Reading | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Surging Cyberattacks Boost Latin America to Riskiest Region
item.description:
The region is up against tactics like data-leak extortion, credential-stealing campaigns, edge-device exploitation, and attackers leveraging AI.
ğŸ“° Source: Dark Reading | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: China-Backed 'PeckBirdy' Takes Flight for Cross-Platform Attacks
item.description:
In two separate campaigns, attackers used the JScript C2 framework to target Chinese gambling websites and Asian government entities with new backdoors.
ğŸ“° Source: Dark Reading | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Consumers Reluctant to Shop at Stores That Don't Take Security Seriously
item.description:
The retail sector must adapt as consumers become more cybersecurity-conscious. Increased attack transparency is a good place to start.
ğŸ“° Source: Dark Reading | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: High-Severity Remote Code Execution Vulnerability Patched in OpenSSL
item.description:
A total of 12 vulnerabilities have been fixed in OpenSSL, all discovered by a single cybersecurity firm. The post High-Severity Remote Code Execution Vulnerability Patched in OpenSSL appeared first on SecurityWeek.
ğŸ“° Source: SecurityWeek | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Fortinet Patches Exploited FortiCloud SSO Authentication Bypass
item.description:
Tracked as CVE-2026-24858, the bug allows attackers to log into devices registered to other FortiCloud accounts. The post Fortinet Patches Exploited FortiCloud SSO Authentication Bypass appeared first on SecurityWeek.
ğŸ“° Source: SecurityWeek | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Indurex Emerges From Stealth to Close Security Gap in Cyber-Physical Systems
item.description:
Indurex was founded by Jalal Bouhdada, who previously led industrial cybersecurity company Applied Risk. The post Indurex Emerges From Stealth to Close Security Gap in Cyber-Physical Systems appeared first on SecurityWeek.
ğŸ“° Source: SecurityWeek | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: APTs, Cybercriminals Widely Exploiting WinRAR Vulnerability
item.description:
Russian and Chinese state-sponsored threat actors have been exploiting CVE-2025-8088 since July 2025. The post APTs, Cybercriminals Widely Exploiting WinRAR Vulnerability appeared first on SecurityWeek.
ğŸ“° Source: SecurityWeek | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: US Charges 31 More Defendants in Massive ATM Hacking Probe
item.description:
A total of 87 individuals, mostly Venezuelan nationals, have been charged for their role in the ATM jackpotting scheme. The post US Charges 31 More Defendants in Massive ATM Hacking Probe appeared first on SecurityWeek.
ğŸ“° Source: SecurityWeek | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: WhatsApp Boosts Account Security for At-Risk Individuals
item.description:
New Strict Account Settings allow users to block attachments and media and silence calls from unknown people. The post WhatsApp Boosts Account Security for At-Risk Individuals appeared first on SecurityWeek.
ğŸ“° Source: SecurityWeek | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Rein Security Emerges From Stealth With $8M, Bringing Inside-Out AppSec Approach
item.description:
Rein aims to close the production visibility gap by stopping attacks inside the application runtime. The post Rein Security Emerges From Stealth With $8M, Bringing Inside-Out AppSec Approach appeared first on SecurityWeek.
ğŸ“° Source: SecurityWeek | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Why We Canâ€™t Let AI Take the Wheel of Cyber Defense
item.description:
The fastest way to squander the promise of AI is to mistake automation for assurance, and novelty for resilience. The post Why We Canâ€™t Let AI Take the Wheel of Cyber Defense appeared first on SecurityWeek.
ğŸ“° Source: SecurityWeek | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Mesh Security Raises $12 Million for CSMA Platform
item.description:
The investment will allow Mesh to advance its autonomous, agentic capabilities, and scale sales and customer support efforts. The post Mesh Security Raises $12 Million for CSMA Platform appeared first on SecurityWeek.
ğŸ“° Source: SecurityWeek | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Cyber Insights 2026: Offensive Security; Where It Is and Where Itâ€™s Going
item.description:
Malicious attacks are increasing in frequency, sophistication and damage. Defenders need to find and harden system weaknesses before attackers can attack them. The post Cyber Insights 2026: Offensive Security; Where It Is and Where Itâ€™s Going appeared first on SecurityWeek.
ğŸ“° Source: SecurityWeek | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: UK leaders warned country risks 'absorbing' cyber and hybrid attacks without offensive deterrence
item.description:
The government must do more to actively disrupt and deter foreign cyber and hybrid threats, U.K. ministers were told at at a parliamentary hearing.
ğŸ“° Source: The Record | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Cyberattack on Polandâ€™s power grid hit around 30 facilities, new report says
item.description:
Adding to previous research about an operation against Poland's electrical grid, analysts at Dragos say it affected dozens of facilities and disrupted operational technology.
ğŸ“° Source: The Record | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Dismantling Defenses: Trump 2.0 Cyber Year in Review
item.description:
The Trump administration has pursued a staggering range of policy pivots this past year that threaten to weaken the nationâ€™s ability and willingness to address a broad spectrum of technology challenges, from cybersecurity and privacy to countering disinformation, fraud and corruption. These shifts, along with the presidentâ€™s efforts to restrict free speech and freedom of the press, have come at such a rapid clip that many readers probably arenâ€™t even aware of them all.
ğŸ“° Source: Krebs on Security | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Happy 16th Birthday, KrebsOnSecurity.com!
item.description:
KrebsOnSecurity.com celebrates its 16th anniversary today! A huge "thank you" to all of our readers -- newcomers, long-timers and drive-by critics alike. Your engagement this past year here has been tremendous and truly a salve on a handful of dark days. Happily, comeuppance was a strong theme running through our coverage in 2025, with a primary focus on entities that enabled complex and globally-dispersed cybercrime services.
ğŸ“° Source: Krebs on Security | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Chinese Mustang Panda hackers deploy infostealers via CoolClient backdoor
item.description:
The Chinese espionage threat group Mustang Panda has updated itsÂ CoolClient backdoor to a new variant that can steal login data from browsers and monitor the clipboard. [...]
ğŸ“° Source: BleepingComputer | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Security News

item.title: New WhatsApp lockdown feature protects high-risk users from hackers
item.description:
Meta has started rolling out a new WhatsApp lockdown-style security feature designed to protect journalists, public figures, and other high-risk individuals from sophisticated threats, including spyware attacks. [...]
ğŸ“° Source: BleepingComputer | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Security News

item.title: Hackers hijack exposed LLM endpoints in Bizarre Bazaar operation
item.description:
A malicious campaign is actively targetingÂ exposed LLM (Large Language Model) service endpoints to commercialize unauthorized access toÂ AI infrastructure. [...]
ğŸ“° Source: BleepingComputer | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Security News

item.title: FBI seizes RAMP cybercrime forum used by ransomware gangs
item.description:
The FBI has seized the notorious RAMP cybercrime forum, a platform used to advertise a wide range of malware and hacking services, and one of the few remaining forums that openly allowed the promotion of ransomware operations. [...]
ğŸ“° Source: BleepingComputer | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Security News

item.title: New sandbox escape flaw exposes n8n instances to RCE attacks
item.description:
Two vulnerabilities in the n8n workflow automation platform could allow attackers to fully compromise affected instances, access sensitive data, and execute arbitrary code on the underlying host. [...]
ğŸ“° Source: BleepingComputer | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Security News

item.title: eScan confirms update server breached to push malicious update
item.description:
MicroWorld Technologies, the maker of the eScan antivirus product, has confirmed that one of its update servers was breached and used to distribute an unauthorized update later analyzed as malicious to a small subset of customers earlier this month. [...]
ğŸ“° Source: BleepingComputer | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Security News

item.title: Cyberattack on Polish energy grid impacted around 30 facilities
item.description:
The coordinated attack on Poland's power grid in late December targeted multiple distributed energy resource (DER) sites across the country, including combined heat and power (CHP) facilities and wind and solar dispatch systems. [...]
ğŸ“° Source: BleepingComputer | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Security News

item.title: Initial access hackers switch to Tsundere Bot for ransomware attacks
item.description:
A prolific initial access broker tracked asÂ TA584 has been observed using the Tsundere Bot alongside XWorm remote access trojanÂ to gain network access that could lead to ransomware attacks. [...]
ğŸ“° Source: BleepingComputer | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Security News

item.title: Microsoft Gave FBI Keys To Unlock Encrypted Data, Exposing Major Privacy Concern
item.description:
Thomas Brewster reports: Early last year, the FBI served Microsoft with a search warrant, asking it to provide recovery keys to unlock encrypted data stored on three laptops. Federal investigators in Guam believed the devices held evidence that would help prove individuals handling the islandâ€™s Covid unemployment assistance program were part of a plot to... Source
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach

item.title: Franceâ€™s Waltio faces ransom threat from notorious hacker collective
item.description:
Caroline Alvarez reports: Waltio, a French crypto tax platform, is under siege from ShinyHunters, a notorious ransomware group claiming to hold the personal data of nearly 50,000 users. ShinyHunters, known for high-profile crypto and corporate hacks, is threatening to leak usersâ€™ 2024 tax reports unless a ransom is paid. Waltio says its services and production... Source
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach

item.title: ShinyHunters claim to be behind SSO-account data theft attacks
item.description:
Lawrence Abrams reports: The ShinyHunters extortion gang claims it is behind a wave of ongoing voice phishing attacks targeting single sign-on (SSO) accounts at Okta, Microsoft, and Google, enabling threat actors to breach corporate SaaS platforms and steal company data for extortion. In these attacks, threat actors impersonate IT support and call employees, tricking them... Source
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach

item.title: Call-On-Doc allegedly had a breach affecting more than 1 million patients. Theyâ€™ve yet to comment.
item.description:
Telehealth provider Call-On-Doc, Inc., dba Call-On-Doc.com, advertises that it has 2 million active patients and treats 150+ medical conditions. It claims to be the most highly rated telehealth service, and it assures patients of â€œstate-of-the-artâ€ data security for their information. But if a post on a hacking forum is accurate, Call-On-Doc recently had a breach... Source
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach

item.title: Hungarian and Romanian Police Detain Young Hackers over Fake Threat Calls
item.description:
Hungarian Conservative reports: Hungarian police, in cooperation with Romanian authorities, have taken action against four young hackers suspected of making false and intimidating phone calls, the National Bureau of Investigation of the Rapid Response Police announced on Monday. The investigation began in mid-July last year after several police units received reports within days of one... Source
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach

item.title: Savannah Best Buy employee says â€˜hacker groupâ€™ blackmailed him into theft ring scheme
item.description:
Lydia Blackstone reports: A 20-year-old Best Buy employee is jailed in Savannah after police said he helped a group of suspected shoplifters walk out of the store with more than $40,000 in merchandise, claiming he was pressured by online blackmail threats. Dorian Allen is charged with theft by taking, according to a Savannah Police Department... Source
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach

item.title: Treasury cancels $21 million in Booz Allen contracts, blaming a breach that happened years ago
item.description:
CNN reports: The Treasury Department cut ties with Booz Allen Hamilton on Monday and announced that it was canceling $21 million in federal contracts with the consulting giant because one of its ex-employees previously leaked President Donald Trumpâ€™s tax returns to the press. A statement from Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent referenced Charles Littlejohn, a onetime... Source
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach

item.title: AI â€œdigital helperâ€ Lena Health breach exposed some Houston Methodist patientsâ€™ medical info (1)
item.description:
On June 1, 2025, the California Applicantsâ€™ Attorneys Association reported that Serviceaide, a provider of AI-powered healthcare software, had suffered a data breach that led toÂ at least six federal class-action lawsuits.Â The breach was caused by an unsecured database that exposed the protected health information of 483,000 patients of Catholic Health in Buffalo, New York.... Source
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach

item.title: UK plans sweeping overhaul of policing amid surge in online crimes
item.description:
Alexander Martin reports: The British government on Monday unveiled plans for a far-reaching overhaul of policing that would centralize the fight against cybercrime, fraud and other internet-enabled offenses, arguing that the current system is no longer equipped for crimes that are increasingly digital and cross geographic borders. Proposals published by the Home Office call for... Source
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach

item.title: Russian ransomware forum seized by U.S. law enforcement
item.description:
Another one bites the dust. Earlier today, the U.S. Attorneyâ€™s Office for the Southern District of Florida and the Computer Crime and Intellectual Property Section of the Department of Justice seized RAMPâ€™s clear net and .onion sites. RAMP (Russian Anonymous Marketplace) became a go-to Russian-language forum for ransomware operators, brokers, developers, and affiliates after all... Source
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach
